alert.note: Alert for Boulder; Jefferson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 12:48PM MDT until June 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in north central Colorado, Larimer. In northeast Colorado, Boulder and Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 245 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1248 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southern Fort Collins, northwestern Arvada, western Westminster, Boulder, Longmont, Loveland, southwestern Broomfield, Lafayette, Louisville, Superior, Berthoud, Lyons, Niwot, Carter Lake, Crisman, Cedar Cove, Eldorado Springs, Masonville, Rocky Flats and Hygiene.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
